com.phunware.engagement

Class Engagement

  • com.phunware.engagement.Engagement

  • public class Engagement

    Main entry for the Phunware Engagement SDK.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Engagement.Builder
      Initializes the singleton Engagement instance with the provided settings. After initialization the Engagement API should be accessed via it's static methods. A standard workflow for initializing the Location Messaging service might look like: public class MyApplication extends Application { @Override public void onCreate() { super.onCreate(); // Create a Engagement instance Engagement lm = new Engagement.Builder(this) .brand("foo") .identifier("1234-5678-90ab-cdef") .environment(Environment.PROD) .build(); // Configure a PwCoreSession and install the Engagement module. PwCoreSession.getInstance().registerKeys(this, "appId", "accessKey", "signatureKey", "encryptionKey"); PwCoreSession.getInstance().installModules(lm.asModule()); } } brand and identifier are provided by Phunware. appId, accessKey, signatureKey and encryptionKey are provided by Phunware and can be found in the strings.xml

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static AnalyticsManager analytics()
      This is just used internally and shouldn't be required in client apps.
      static AttributeManager attributeManager()
      Returns the AttributeManager from the Engagement service. This method can only be called after the Engagement service has been initialized using the Engagement.Builder.
      static Config config() 
      static java.lang.String deviceId() 
      static void enablePushNotifications()
      Enables push notifications for the application. This will take all of the information provided in the users google-services.json and interact with Google in order to enable push notifications through GCM/FCM. This method can only be called after the Engagement service has been initialized using the Engagement.Builder.
      static LocationManager locationManager()
      Returns the LocationManager from the Engagement service. This method can only be called after the Engagement service has been initialized using the Engagement.Builder.
      static MessageManager messageManager()
      Returns the MessageManager from the Engagement service. This method can only be called after the Engagement service has been initialized using the Engagement.Builder.
      static NetworkManager networkManager()
      This is just used internally and shouldn't be required in client apps.
      static SecurePreferences preferences()
      This is just used internally and shouldn't be required in client apps.
      static void sendStaticId()
      Sends the users unique identifer as an encrypted string that will be registered with the current device This method can only be called after the Engagement service has been initialized using the Engagement.Builder.

      • sendStaticId

        public static void sendStaticId()

        Sends the users unique identifer as an encrypted string that will be registered with the current device This method can only be called after the Engagement service has been initialized using the Engagement.Builder.

      • enablePushNotifications

        public static void enablePushNotifications()

        Enables push notifications for the application. This will take all of the information provided in the users google-services.json and interact with Google in order to enable push notifications through GCM/FCM. This method can only be called after the Engagement service has been initialized using the Engagement.Builder.
